gurmukhi: hir sMg khXo iem gÍwrn ky Ab kuMj glIn mY Kyl sc`eIXY ]nwcq Kylq BwNq BlI su khXo XON suMdr gIq bs`eIXY ]
transliteration: Har(i) San Kahyo Im Gvaaran Ke Ab Kounj Gadeen Mai Khel Machaeeyaee|| Naachat Khelat Bhaant Bhalibhalisu Kahyo Yaaoun Soundar Geet Basaeeyai||
translation: Krishna said to gopis, “Now the amorous play be performed in alcoves and streets; while dancing and playing, charming songs may be sung;

gurmukhi: jw ky kIey mnu hoq KuSI sunIXY auiT kY soaU kwrj k`eIXY ]qIr ndI hmrI isK lY suK Awpn dY hm hUM suK d`eIXY ]655]
transliteration: Jaa Ke Keee Man(u) Hot Khoushisouneeyai Outh(i) Kai Sooo Kaaraj Kaeeyai|| Teer Nadihamrisikh Lai Soukh Aapan Dai Ham Hoon Soukh Daeeyai||655||
translation: The work on doing which the mind is pleased, the same work should be done; whatever you had done under my instruction n the bank of the river, enjoy yourselves in the same way, also imparting the pleasure to me.655.

gurmukhi: kwnH ko Awies mwn qRIXw biRj kuMj glIn mY Kyl mcwXo ]gwie auTI soeI gIq BlI ibiD jo hir ky mn BIqr BwXo ]
transliteration: Kaahn Ko Aaees Maan Triyaa Brij Kounj Gadeen Mai Khel Machadyo|| Gade Outhisoigeet Bhalibidh(i) Jo Har(i) Ke Man Bheetar Bhaayo||
translation: Obeying Krishna, the women began the performance of the amorous play in the streets and chamber of Braja, and began to sing songs which Krishna liked;

gurmukhi: dyvgMDwr Aau su`D mlRwr ibKY soaU BwiK iKAwl bswXo ]rIJ rhXo pur mMfl Aau sur mMfl pY ijnhUM sun pwXo ]656]
transliteration: Devgaddhaar Au Suddh Malhaar Bikhai Sooo Bhaakh(i) Khiaal Basaayo|| Rijh Rahyo Pur Mandal Au Sur Mandal Pai Jinhoon Soun Paayo||656||
translation: They sand in the musical modes of Gandhar and Shuddh Malhar; whosoever heard it on the earth or in heaven was fascinated.656.

gurmukhi: kwnH khXo isr pY Dr kY imil kuMjn mY suB BwNq geI hY ]kuMj muKI qn kMcn sy sB rUp ibKY mno mYn meI hY ]
transliteration: Kaahn Kahyo Sir Pai Dhar Kai Mil(i) Kounjan Mai Soubh Bhaant Gadhai|| Kounj Moukhitan Kanchanndse Sabh Roop Bikhai Mano Main Maihai||
translation: All the gopis met Krishna in alcoves; their faces are like gold and the whole figure is inebriated with lust;

gurmukhi: Kyl ibKY rs kI so qRIXw sB sXwm ky Awgy hÍY AYsy DeI hY ]XO kib sXwm khY aupmw gj gwmn kwmn rUp BeI hY ]657]
transliteration: Khel Bikhai Ras Kitreeyaa Sabh Syaam Ke Aage Hvai Aise Dhaihai|| You Kabi Syaam Kahai Oupmaa Gad Gadmanndkaamanndroop Bhaee||657||
translation: In the play, the women are running in front of Krishna and the poet says that all are extremely beautiful damsels with the gait of the elephants.657.

gurmukhi: kwnH CuhXo chY gÍwrin kO soaU Bwg clY nhI dyq CuhweI ]ijau miRgnI Apny piq ko riq kyl smy nhI dyq imlweI ]
transliteration: Kaahn Chuhyo Chahai Gvaaran(i) Kau Sooo Bhaag Chalai Nahidet Chhuhaaijio Mrigadiapne Pat(i) Ko Rat(i) Kel Same Nahidet Milaaee||
translation: The gopis are not permitting Krishna to touch that part of the body, which he wants to touch, just like the doe slipping away from the deer during the sex-play;

gurmukhi: kuMjn BIqr qIr ndI biRK Bwn suqw su iPrY qh DweI ]Taur qhw kib sXwm khY ieh BwNq so sXwm jU Kyl mcweI ]658]
transliteration: Kounjan Bheetar Teer Nadibrikh Bhaan Soutaa Su Phirai Tha Dhaaee|| Thaur Tahaa Kabi Syaam Kahai Eh Bhaant So Syaam Joo Khel Machaaee||658||
translation: On the bank of the river, within the alcoves, Radha is moving speedily hither and thither and according to the poet, in this way, Krishna has raised a tumult about the play.658.

gurmukhi: rwq krI CT mwsn kI Aiq au`jl pY soaU ArD AMDyrI ]qwhI smY iqh Taur ibKY kib sXwm sBY hir gÍwrin GyrI ]
transliteration: Raat Karichhatmaasan Kiat(i) Ujjal Pai Sooo Ardh Andderee|| Taahisamai Tih Thaur Bikhai Kabi Syaam Sabhai Har(i) Gvaaran(i) Gderee||
translation: The bright night of six months now changed into dark night alongwith the tumult about the play; at the same time Krishna besieged all the gopis;

gurmukhi: nYn kI kor ktwCn pyKq JUm igrI iek hÍY geI cyrI ]XO aupjI aupmw ijX mY sr so miRgnI ijm Gwvq hyrI ]659]
transliteration: Nain Ki Kor Kataachhan Pekhat Jhoom Giriik Hvai Gadcderee|| You Oupjioupmaa Jiya Mai Sar So Mrigadijim Ghaavat Deree||659||
translation: Someone got intoxicated on seeing the side-glanced of his eyes and someone immediately became his slaver; they were moving like the does in a group towards the tank.659.

gurmukhi: Pyr auTY auTqy hI BgY jdurw kO n gÍwrn dyq imlweI ]pwCY prY iqn ky hir jU cV kY rs kY hX aUpr DweI ]
transliteration: Pher Outhai Outhate Hibhagad Jaduraa Kau Na Gvaaran Det Milaaee|| Pachhai Darai Tin Ke Har(i) Joo Chad Kai Ras Kai Hay Oopar Dhaaee||
translation: Krishna got up and ran, but still the gopis could not be caught by him; he pursued them riding the steed of his passion;

gurmukhi: rwDy ko nYnn ky sr sMg bDY mno Bauh kmwn cVweI ]JUm igryN DrnI pr so miRgnI miRghI mno mwr igrweI ]660]
transliteration: Raadhe Ko Nainan Ke Sar San Badhai Mano Bhauh Kamaan Chadhaaee|| Jhoom Giren Dharanidar So Mrigadimrigadimano Maar Giraaee||660||
translation: Radha was pierced by the arrows of his eyes discharged from the bow of his eyebrows and she has fallen down on the earth like a doe fallen down by a hunter.660.

gurmukhi: suD lY biRKBwn suqw qb hI hir A`gRj kuMjn mY auT BwgY ]rs so jdurwie mhw rsIAw qb hI iqh ky ipCUAwn so lwgY ]
transliteration: Sudh Lai Brikhbhaan Soutaa Tab Hihar(i) Aggraj Kounjan Mai Outh Bhaagad|| Ras So Daduraae Mahaa Raseeaa Tab Hitih Ke Pichhodhaan So Laagad||
translation: On regarding consciousness, Radha began to run in front of Krishan in those street-chambers; great aesthete Krishna, then closely followed her;
